nodes.tag: Reads and writes three-digit numbers up to 999 using place value.
Compares and orders numbers up to 999 based on their place value.
Reads and writes large numbers (greater than 1000) used in daily life situations.
Uses place value understanding to perform addition, subtraction, multiplication and division on numbers greater than 1000.
Adds three-digit numbers with and without regrouping where the sum does not exceed 999.
Subtracts three-digit numbers with and without regrouping.
Solves simple daily life problems involving addition and subtraction of three-digit numbers.
Applies number operations to solve problems in daily life situations.
Uses place value understanding to perform addition, subtraction, multiplication and division on numbers greater than 1000.
Estimates the sum, difference, product and quotient of numbers.
Verifies estimated answers using different strategies such as standard algorithms and breaking numbers into parts.
Solves problems involving large numbers by applying appropriate operations such as addition, subtraction, multiplication and division.
Solves problems involving addition and subtraction of integers.
Solves daily life problems involving addition and subtraction of fractions and decimals.
Solves daily life problems involving rational numbers.
Generalises the properties of addition, subtraction, multiplication and division of rational numbers through patterns.
Constructs and uses multiplication tables of 2, 3, 4, 5 and 10 in daily life situations.
Analyses a given situation and selects the appropriate number operation.
Explains division as equal grouping or equal sharing.
Finds division facts using repeated subtraction (e.g., 12 รท 3).
Applies number operations to solve problems in daily life situations.
Multiplies two-digit numbers by one-digit numbers.
Multiplies three-digit numbers by one-digit numbers.
Divides a number using pictorial representation, equal grouping and repeated subtraction.
Explains division using the relationship between multiplication and division.
Uses place value understanding to perform addition, subtraction, multiplication and division on numbers greater than 1000.
Divides a given number by another number using standard division algorithms.
Estimates the sum, difference, product and quotient of numbers.
Verifies estimated answers using different strategies such as standard algorithms and breaking numbers into parts.
Solves problems involving large numbers by applying appropriate operations such as addition, subtraction, multiplication and division.
Multiplies and divides two integers.
Generalises the properties of addition, subtraction, multiplication and division of rational numbers through patterns.
Explains and proves the divisibility rules of 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9 and 11 using patterns and examples.
Identifies one-half, one-fourth and three-fourths of a whole using pictures and paper folding.
Identifies one-half, one-fourth and three-fourths in a collection of objects.
Represents one-half, one-fourth and three-fourths using numerals.
Demonstrates the equivalence of fractions using models and examples.
Finds the number corresponding to a given fractional part of a collection.
Identifies and forms equivalent fractions of a given fraction.
Uses fractions and decimals to represent and solve problems related to money, length, distance and temperature.
Solves daily life problems involving addition and subtraction of fractions and decimals.
Interprets multiplication of fractions as a part of a part (e.g., 2/3 ร 4/5 as two-thirds of four-fifths).
Interprets division of fractions as finding how many equal parts make a whole (e.g., 1/2 รท 1/4).
Uses standard algorithms to multiply and divide fractions.
Solves daily life problems involving rational numbers.
Generalises the properties of addition, subtraction, multiplication and division of rational numbers through patterns.
Finds as many rational numbers as possible between two given rational numbers.
Expresses fractions such as 1/2, 1/4 and 1/5 in decimal notation.
Expresses decimals as fractions in real-life contexts such as length and money.
Converts fractions into decimals and decimals into fractions.
Uses fractions and decimals to represent and solve problems related to money, length, distance and temperature.
Solves daily life problems involving addition and subtraction of fractions and decimals.
Uses standard algorithms to multiply and divide decimals.
Solves daily life problems involving rational numbers.
Generalises the properties of addition, subtraction, multiplication and division of rational numbers through patterns.
Identifies and classifies numbers as even, odd, prime and co-prime using number patterns.
Applies the concept of HCF or LCM to solve problems in given situations.
Explains and proves the divisibility rules of 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9 and 11 using patterns and examples.
Adds small amounts of money with and without regrouping.
Subtracts small amounts of money with and without regrouping.
Prepares simple rate charts.
Reads and prepares simple bills for daily life situations.
Creates and solves simple real-life problems involving money, length, mass and capacity using the four operations.
Expresses decimals as fractions in real-life contexts such as length and money.
Uses fractions and decimals to represent and solve problems related to money, length, distance and temperature.
